title: Priapus
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Benton Murdoch Spruance [1904-1967], Philadelphia, PA. Charles Sessler, Philadelphia, PA, until October 1968; Mr. [1898-1987] and Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA, October 1968 until December 8, 1977 [1]; gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1977 [2].

Notes:
[1]. The Beals purchased the lithograph for $100 on October 26, 1968. It arrived at the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute from Sessler's on November 13, 1968. It was still being stored at the museum on June 23, 1969 at the request of the Beals (see relevant memo with hand-written notes by Mrs. Beal in curatorial file.)
[2]. The lithograph was accessioned on December 8, 1977.
